newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Jardine Matheson cites problems as 1996 net falls.
newsitem.headline: Jardine Matheson cites problems as 1996 net falls.

text.p: Jardine Matheson Holdings Ltd said on Thursday that 1996 net profits fell to US$300.2 million and blamed a string of problems for the drop.
The results for the year to December 1996 compared with 1995's net profit after tax and outside interests of US$420 million.

The company cited various problems in 1996, including the disposal of its Sizzler restaurant chain in Australia, the repositioning of Australian and British retail operations and a US$26 million charge for regulatory breaches at Jardine Fleming Investment Management.

"The actions we have taken to refine and strengthen our businesses should enable us to maintain a steady trading result in 1997, and we look forward to improved earnings growth coming through in subsequent years," chairman Henry Keswick said in a statement.
At the heart of the vast Jardine empire, Jardine Matheson holds just under 60 percent of Jardine Strategic Holdings Ltd, which in turn owns 36 percent of Jardine Matheson.
Jardine Strategic on Thursday unveiled 1996 attributable profits of US$301.9 million, compared to US$291.7 million in 1995.
Jardine Strategic, the group's listed holding company, also said it would offer shareholders a bonus issue of put warrants on a one-for-20 basis, exerciseable at US$3.80 on July 7.

Jardine Strategic owns 52 percent of retailer Dairy Farm International Holdings Ltd, 23 percent of motor distributor Cycle & Carriage, 51 percent of hotelier Mandarin Oriental International Ltd and 32 percent of property group Hongkong Land Holdings Ltd.

Jardine Matheson owns 75 percent of motor distributor Jardine International Motor Holdings Ltd, 50 percent of securities arm Jardine Fleming and 100 percent of trading and services group Jardine Pacific.

Jardine Pacific's profit from underlying businesses came to US$94 million, down seven percent, mainly due to weaker performances by its Pizza Hut operations and to a difficult Thai market, the company said.
Other group companies have reported either falls in core net profits -- Dairy Farm and Jardine International Motor Holdings -- or relatively low rises -- Hongkong Land and Mandarin Oriental.
Earlier, there were signs that sometimes tense relations between Jardine, whose founding was tied up with Hong Kong's birth as a British colony, and China were on the mend.
Jardine Fleming said on Thursday it had been appointed as underwriter for a large Hong Kong listing by a Chinese company after three years of exclusion from such deals.

"From where I sit we did have a more difficult period in our relations with China two or three years ago, but there has been a steady improvement over time," Jardine Matheson managing director Alasdair Morrison told Reuters by telephone.
But he said the group had spent "a lot of time explaining our commitment to Hong Kong, our commitment to developing our business in mainland China" to the Chinese government.
Jardine Matheson holds assets of more than US$10 billion in Hong Kong and is the largest private sector employee in the territory with 60,000 staff, he said.
China resumes sovereignty over Hong Kong on July 1 after more than 150 years of British rule.
